file_content.text: Thanks for your work. Now our outposts can survive another month.
Find Commander Yajak when you reach Outpost Four. He'll want to know that food is coming.
Normally, our fourth outpost comes here to pick up its supplies, but their convoy never arrived this month.
I'm afraid something happened--they need to be found.
Just tell me where to look.
Want me to find out what?
You've got to be the best friend these soldiers ever had.
Thanks. I guess you do care, even if you didn't want to risk the dust-up over turning Gardit in.
It's dangerous territory out there. Was the convoy armed?
You think they're dead?
The route between the outposts runs along Lake Brell--not the best planning. There's rakghouls there and a nexu spawning ground, and worse.
Usually the convoys manage by only traveling when the sun is highest. Plus lots and lots of firepower.
But if they're out there too long... well, you need to find them.
Every moment we delay risks their lives. I'll leave right now.
Then time is of the essence.
That's a lot of risk to take out of the goodness of my heart....
Got any incentive?
I'll scrounge up some credits if that's what motivates you.
Sure, if credits are all you want, I can find you some.
I'm on my way.
It's a deal.
Give me some details.
Whatever happened to the convoy, we need to make sure Morne Outpost gets their supplies.
Sonic emitters along the route usually keep off the worst of the critters. But if they're on the fritz, that convoy would have walked into a feeding frenzy.
Fix the emitters and see what you can find about the convoy. When you're done, report to Commander Yajak at Morne Outpost. And thank you.
There are better ways to earn money, even on Taris.
Nevermind. [Refuse quest]
Not my concern. [Refuse quest]
I'll pass. [Refuse quest]
You and Gardit are exactly the same. All you care about are yourselves!
I understand. Maybe now that they're fed, our soldiers will be able to man a search party....
We don't have antibiotics. They come on the same ship as everything else.
You're supposed to keep better tabs on that sort of thing. These men have the Csillian flu. They could die if--
Ah, you've returned. And with all of you unhurt. Dare I ask if you've managed to recover our supplies?
Master Jedi! Dare I hope you've made it to our ship?
No number of beasts could have kept me from aiding these men.
Your men are saved.
Your order is known for its mercy. Thank you for coming to our aid.
Lieutenant! Do I read from your face that you've brought welcome news?
Tell your men they're off rationing.
The supplies are here.
Not a moment too soon, Lieutenant. Let me tell you, you really saved my stripes on this one.
Ah, our great hope has returned. Dare I ask if you've been able to recover our supplies?
And I didn't even take a gratuity.
It's all right here.
Ha. You freelancers. Always taking a poke at us soldiers, huh?
Everything's here.
Just in the nick of time, too.
The men came close to mutiny when I cut rations again. Hmph. They knew this wasn't going to be a luxury cruise.
Your outpost won't starve now, no thanks to you.
What do you care?
Now you just watch yourself. I did everything in my power to--
What do you expect? You ask your men to starve while you eat bantha steaks from offworld?
These pictures prove you knew the ship was damaged, and you sent it anyway.
I'll see him court-martialed.
They're going to Republic Command. Along with my documentation of every personal purchase you've made.
These men left their families and risked their lives to come here. If they die, it should be for someone better than you.
I--I didn't know the ship was so bad. I thought, if it was serious, they'd catch it on Ord Mantell.
You should be ashamed of what you've done.
You abused your authority.
How dare you talk to me like that?
I appreciate your help, but maybe you'd better move on now.
All due respect, Master Jedi, but this is my command, and you're a guest here.
I outrank you, soldier, whatever your heroics.
How many crimes would you be wanted for in Republic space if I were to start looking?
And you--
I've sent every report ever made about the ship's condition to Republic Command. If they discover the cause of the crash, you're in serious trouble.
The men on Taris deserve a better leader.
You should lose your command.
A good commander lives under the same conditions as his troops.
Make it up to the men.
I never realized how quickly we go through our supplies. If I'd thought we couldn't last the month, I--
I have some, uh, personal stores. I'll distribute them while you finish here. As a gesture of good faith.
I never thought I'd see anyone put the righteous fear into him like that. Good job, and thank you.
Work it out.
This is ridiculous. I did nothing wrong. Republic Command will never listen to you.
I--I need to call them.
Thank you for all your help. But there may be something else, too.
Don't talk that way to your commander, quartermaster.
Respect the chain of command.
Excuse me, sir. What I meant to say, sir, is that maybe fixing the ship before it crashed would have cost us fewer lives. Respectfully.
Just distribute the food, Private. We'll talk later.
And you--the men of this outpost owe you a debt of gratitude. We all do.
These men have given up a lot to serve the Republic.
I was glad to help.
No thanks needed.
There's got to be somewhere more interesting than this--even on Taris.
Are we done?
It was a pleasure to work with you.
Actually, if you're still interested in serving our soldiers, there may be something else....
Get me those pictures, and I promise we'll bring Commander Gardit to justice.
And you're just going to make this all better, huh?
Usually people are happy if I come to make things better.
What?
Who are you?
I'm Kahrin Wek, quartermaster. Commander Gardit just called to say you're retrieving our supplies. For which, by the way, I and the rest of the troops here humbly thank you.
Want to calm down and point me to where your supply ship crashed?
I'm just here about the ship.
Of course! You think I want to see everyone here starve?
But I don't want Commander Fat-Pants to think it means he gets away with this.
Steal from your troops, spend the Republic's money on vintage wine from Alderaan, but it's fine, because there's a gang of big-hearted heroes around to save you.
Steal from your troops, waste Republic money bringing in silks and wine from Alderaan, and it's fine, because some wandering Jedi will happen in to save you.
Embezzle the Republic's money to bring in dress blues from Alderaan, but don't worry, one of our top Special Forces guys will bail you out.
Embezzle the Republic's money to build your office out of Alderaanian timber, but that's fine, because someone like you will waltz in to save the day.
That's a serious accusation.
The commander's embezzling?
What are you talking about?
The ship didn't have to crash.
I didn't come here to get yelled at.
Directions? Map? Something?
Then let me be straight. Getting our supplies would be a great help, but pulling Commander Gardit from his position would be the best help of all.
I said over and over that that ship needed repairs. The left stasis generator was loose, and the hyperdrive motivator was seeping fluid.
But Gardit had already spent our allotted maintenance budget. On himself.
Putting his men at risk for his own indulgences is a grievous misuse of authority.
He should be punished.
And then some! But he simply slashed the rations budget in half and figures it's over.
The men are starving. And starving men don't hold up well against creatures where one tiny scratch could lead to a base-wide epidemic.
It is only with calm purpose that you can bring him to justice.
You must control your anger.
Oh, if that's what it takes, I can be calm as a cloudless day.
If this is true, he's a blot on the Republic, and I'll bring him down.
He won't get away with it.
These are good soldiers, here. They deserve a better man to lead them.
I noticed he had a pretty posh setup.
That explains the gold drapes.
Every shipment has some personal item he's bringing in.
Can you prove this?
You have proof?
I don't believe you.
I'm telling the truth.
Somehow he's juggling the numbers he sends to HQ. No commander needs a personal vehicle in an outpost this size.
If you can take this holocamera out to the crash site, you could get the evidence I need to get him court-martialed.
What kind of evidence do you think I'll find?
What are you asking me to do?
Here. Take the camera.
Give me the camera.
Thank you.
If you take holopics of the engines, I can show that the documented lack of repairs is what caused the crash.
I want no part of your personal crusade.
You're wrong.
Just take the camera. You'll see the damaged parts for yourself. Take holopics of the engines, it'll take no time.
If you're not convinced, just bring the supplies. But if you happen to be overcome by a patriotic rage against Commander Gardit's greed, at least you'll be prepared.
The most important thing is the supplies, though. The crash site isn't far. When you get everything, bring it back here so I can distribute it.
We're under strict rationing right now. No food or fresh water until tomorrow.
